trans-unit.source: The base <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl"></xref> class is an abstract class from which concrete text-based controls are derived.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Label>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command> controls are examples of controls derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl> class.

Every control that is based on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl> class has a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property, which can be programmatically modified.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property is usually used to render the control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl"></xref> class.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Sets or returns the text for the control.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

For an object that inherits the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl> class, this property renders the text of the control.
The default value is an empty string.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property can be specified by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> attribute, or as inner text.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property is specified in both ways, the inner text always takes precedence.
However, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property is programmatically set, the inner text is automatically removed and the newly set property takes precedence.
